content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs the system, I recall that the user used the "google" command to search for information on the Inca empire. Command google returned various links related to the Inca empire. The user then used the "browse_website" command to access the Wikipedia page on the Inca empire and asked "What is the Inca empire?" Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The Inca Empire was a pre-Columbian civilization that existed in South America from the early 13th century until the Spanish conquest in the 16th century. It was the largest empire in pre-Columbian America, known for its monumental architecture, extensive road network, finely-woven textiles, use of knotted strings for record keeping and communication, agricultural innovations, and unique system of exchange based on reciprocity. The empire was organized into a central government with the Inca at its head and four provincial governments with strong leaders. The Inca society was linguistically diverse, with Quechua being the most important language. The Inca religion was polytheistic and centered around the worship of nature deities. The empire was eventually conquered by the Spanish, leading to the downfall of the Inca civilization. Additionally, I received a command from the user to write the information to a file named "inca_empire.txt". The text in the file includes a more detailed description of the Inca Empire, including its location in the Andean Mountains. My computer returned that the file was written to successfully. The user then attempted to list files in the current directory, but the command returned too much output and should not be executed again with the same arguments. The user then attempted to read a file with a filename of ".", but this command is invalid and should be corrected. My computer executed the shell command "ls | grep inca_empire.txt" successfully and the output was "inca_empire.txt". The user then requested to read the file "inca_empire.txt" and my computer returned the information on the Inca Empire as previously described.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "Quechua language"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command google returned: ["https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quechuan_languages", "https://www.mustgo.com/worldlanguages/quechua/", "https://plc.sas.upenn.edu/quechua", "https://www.gviusa.com/blog/quechua-the-surviving-language-of-the-inca-empire/", "https://web.sas.upenn.edu/quechua/", "https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/feature/2014/04/16/discriminados-por-hablar-su-idioma-natal-peru-quechua", "https://chss.rowan.edu/home_page_highlights/mother_tongue.html", "https://omniglot.com/writing/quechua.htm"]'}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quechuan_languages", "question": "What is the Quechua language?"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The Quechua language is a family of indigenous languages spoken primarily in the Andes region of South America, including Peru, Bolivia, Ecuador, Colombia, and Chile. It is the most widely spoken pre-Columbian language family of the Americas, with an estimated 8-10 million speakers as of 2004. Quechua was the main language family of the Inca Empire and is still widely spoken today, being the co-official language of many regions and the second most spoken language family in Peru. The language has been recognized as an official language in Peru, Ecuador, and Bolivia. The text provides additional information on the grammar, dialects, and cultural significance of the Quechua language. \n \n Links: ['Jump to content (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quechuan_languages#bodyContent)', 'Main page (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page)', 'Contents (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents)', 'Current events (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events)', 'Random article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random)']"}]
"""
